events.name: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Visit to Kyiv
events.wd_label: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Visit to Kyiv
events.wd_description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak visited Kyiv, pledging continued support for Ukraine and announcing a new £50 million air defense package to help counter Russian drone attacks.
events.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak visited Kyiv, pledging continued support for Ukraine and announcing a new £50 million air defense package to help counter Russian drone attacks.

events.name: Sunak's Visit to Kyiv
events.wd_description: Rishi Sunak made his first visit to Kyiv as the UK Prime Minister, reaffirming Britain's support for Ukraine and emphasizing the UK's commitment to standing with Ukraine.
events.description: Rishi Sunak made his first visit to Kyiv as the UK Prime Minister, reaffirming Britain's support for Ukraine and emphasizing the UK's commitment to standing with Ukraine.

events.name: New Air Defense Package
events.wd_description: Sunak announced a £50 million ($60 million) package, including anti-aircraft guns and radar technology, to help Ukraine defend against Russian drone attacks.
events.description: Sunak announced a £50 million ($60 million) package, including anti-aircraft guns and radar technology, to help Ukraine defend against Russian drone attacks.

events.name: Continued UK Support for Ukraine
events.wd_description: The UK pledged to increase the training provided to Ukrainian armed forces, reinforcing its ongoing support for Ukraine's defense efforts.
events.description: The UK pledged to increase the training provided to Ukrainian armed forces, reinforcing its ongoing support for Ukraine's defense efforts.

events.name: Ukraine Faces Russian Attacks as NATO and Poland Investigate Missile Crash
events.wd_label: Ukraine Faces Russian Attacks as NATO and Poland Investigate Missile Crash
events.wd_description: Ukraine faced renewed Russian attacks in the east as NATO and Poland concluded that a missile crash in Poland, which killed two people, was likely caused by a stray Ukrainian air defense missile.
events.description: Ukraine faced renewed Russian attacks in the east as NATO and Poland concluded that a missile crash in Poland, which killed two people, was likely caused by a stray Ukrainian air defense missile.

events.name: Russian Attacks in Eastern Ukraine
events.wd_description: Ukraine confirmed fierce attacks in the east by Russian forces, which were reinforced with troops withdrawn from Kherson, following intense strikes on civilian infrastructure.
events.description: Ukraine confirmed fierce attacks in the east by Russian forces, which were reinforced with troops withdrawn from Kherson, following intense strikes on civilian infrastructure.

events.name: Missile Crash in Poland
events.wd_description: A missile crash at a grain facility in Poland, near the Ukrainian border, killed two people, marking the first deadly extension of the war into NATO territory.
events.description: A missile crash at a grain facility in Poland, near the Ukrainian border, killed two people, marking the first deadly extension of the war into NATO territory.

events.name: NATO and Poland's Conclusion
events.wd_description: NATO and Poland concluded that the missile was likely a stray S-300 rocket fired by Ukraine's air defenses, with no evidence suggesting it was launched by Russia.
events.description: NATO and Poland concluded that the missile was likely a stray S-300 rocket fired by Ukraine's air defenses, with no evidence suggesting it was launched by Russia.

events.name: Dismissal of Germany's Cybersecurity Chief
events.wd_description: Germany's cybersecurity chief, Arne Schönbohm, was fired after allegations surfaced of his connections to a firm linked to Russian security circles, following a satirical TV show revelation.
events.description: Germany's cybersecurity chief, Arne Schönbohm, was fired after allegations surfaced of his connections to a firm linked to Russian security circles, following a satirical TV show revelation.

events.name: Dismissal of Schönbohm
events.wd_description: Arne Schönbohm, head of the German Federal Office for Information, was relieved of his duties as the country’s cybersecurity chief following allegations of ties to a Russian-linked firm.
events.description: Arne Schönbohm, head of the German Federal Office for Information, was relieved of his duties as the country’s cybersecurity chief following allegations of ties to a Russian-linked firm.

events.name: Allegations of Russian Connections
events.wd_description: Schönbohm's dismissal came after reports of his past connections to a Russian-linked cybersecurity firm, highlighted by a German satire show.
events.description: Schönbohm's dismissal came after reports of his past connections to a Russian-linked cybersecurity firm, highlighted by a German satire show.

events.name: Public Scrutiny
events.wd_description: The controversy surrounding Schönbohm's connections was brought to public attention by a satire show hosted by German comedian Jan Böhmermann, leading to increased scrutiny.
events.description: The controversy surrounding Schönbohm's connections was brought to public attention by a satire show hosted by German comedian Jan Böhmermann, leading to increased scrutiny.

events.name: GM's Efforts to Secure Battery Materials for EV Production
events.wd_label: GM's Efforts to Secure Battery Materials for EV Production
events.wd_description: General Motors is securing materials needed to support its plans for battery-electric vehicles by building a North American supply chain and partnering with companies like Vale and Microvast.
events.description: General Motors is securing materials needed to support its plans for battery-electric vehicles by building a North American supply chain and partnering with companies like Vale and Microvast.

events.name: Agreement with Vale for Nickel Sulfate
events.wd_label: Agreement with Vale for Nickel Sulfate
events.wd_description: GM has reached an agreement with Vale S.A. for the long-term supply of battery-grade nickel sulfate from Vale's proposed plant in Bécancour, Québec, to support its BEV production needs.
events.description: GM has reached an agreement with Vale S.A. for the long-term supply of battery-grade nickel sulfate from Vale's proposed plant in Bécancour, Québec, to support its BEV production needs.

events.name: Collaboration with Microvast
events.wd_description: GM and Microvast are developing specialized battery separator technology and building a new separator plant in the U.S., supported by a $200 million grant from the U.S. Department of Energy.
events.description: GM and Microvast are developing specialized battery separator technology and building a new separator plant in the U.S., supported by a $200 million grant from the U.S. Department of Energy.

events.name: Participation in Battery500 Consortium
events.wd_description: GM is participating in the Battery500 Consortium, which is awarded $75 million for research on developing more reliable, affordable, longer-range, and higher-performance batteries.
events.description: GM is participating in the Battery500 Consortium, which is awarded $75 million for research on developing more reliable, affordable, longer-range, and higher-performance batteries.
